edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_library.inventory

Class Book

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_library.inventory.Book
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Book>

    public class Book
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Book>
    This class defines the methods of a book object for the Wolf Library project. It contains the information about the book as well as methods for accessing the book and keeping track of the copies currently in stock.
    Author:
    Marcus

    • Constructor Detail

      • Book

        public Book(java.lang.String info)
        The constructor constructs a book object given info from a file. It accepts input from a line of text in an input file. The input should come in the form . The book object parses this string into the parts it needs to construct the book for use by the Wolf Library program.
        Parameters:
        info - the book's author and title information

    • Method Detail

      • getInfo

        public java.lang.String getInfo()
        The get info method is a simple getter for the information about a book.
        Returns:
        info the title and author information for the selected book

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        The to string method returns a string representation of the book based on whether or not it's available. If copies exist in stock, it returns the book. Otherwise, it returns the listing prepended with an asterisk.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        libraryListing a book listing from the inventory

      • isAvailable

        public boolean isAvailable()
        The is available method is a simple boolean test for whether or not any copies of a book are available.
        Returns:
        true if there are copies available and false otherwise

      • backToInventory

        public void backToInventory()
        The back to inventory method puts a copy of the book back into the inventory stock. It simply increments the number available.

      • removeOneCopyFromInventory

        public void removeOneCopyFromInventory()
        The remove one copy from inventory method removes a copy of the book from the inventory stock. It simply decrements the number available.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Book other)
        The compare to method compares one book to another for sorting purposes. It takes two books and returns an integer values based on which one is larger than the other. The compare to method ignores books with information prefixed by "a", "an", or "the." It calls another method to strip the books of those prefixes for the purposes of comparison.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Book>
        Parameters:
        other - another book to compare to for sorting purposes
        Returns:
        an integer value obtained via lexicographical comparison
